meanings.definition: A person who pretends to give an impartial endorsement of something in which they have an interest.
meanings.sent1: The audience saw through the shills' fake enthusiasm for the product.
meanings.sent2: The company hired shills to boost their sales at the event.
meanings.sent3: The shills at the fair were so obvious, they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The shills in the play were like puppets controlled by the main character.
meanings.sent5: The shills' exaggerated smiles made them stand out in the crowd.

meanings.sent1: He shills for the company by promoting their products online.
meanings.sent2: She shills for the new restaurant by recommending it to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would shill for any brand that paid him.
meanings.sent4: The politician shills for votes by promising unrealistic changes.
meanings.sent5: The actor shills for the movie by attending every premiere.
